newsitem.title: USA: Tyco sees EPS accretion from ADT deal.
newsitem.headline: Tyco sees EPS accretion from ADT deal.

text.p: Tyco International Ltd chairman L. Dennis Kozlowski said he expects Tyco's $5.6 billion stock merger with ADT Ltd to lift Tyco's fiscal 1998 earnings by $0.20 per share, or $50 to $52 million, above Wall Street estimates.

The projection assumes the friendly deal will close by June 30, the end of Tyco's fiscal year, Kozlowski said during a conference call with investors, analysts and media detailing the pact announced early Monday morning.
The current Wall Street estimate for Tyco's fiscal 1998 earnings is $3.00 per share, according to Zack's Investment Research.
In the merger's second year, expected accretion is $0.35 per share above the analyst view, and in the third year accretion is projected at $0.45 per share.
Analyst earnings estimates for the second and third years were not immediately available.
Kozlowski said he "firmly believes" the deal will close by June 30, and noted the deal needs a majority of ADT shareholder approval and two-thirds backing by Tyco holders.
